content.question:
<math alttext="C H 3 C O O H aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C H 3 C O O with a negative 1 charge aqueous. p K sub a equals 4.76 at 25 degrees Celsius " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>COO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>at</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
The equilibrium representing the acid dissociation of <math alttext="C H 3 C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown above. A buffer solution is prepared by adding <math alttext="0.10 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N a O H solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>NaOH(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="1.00 liter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="0.30 molar C H 3 C O O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Assuming the change in volume is negligible, which of the following expressions will give the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the resulting buffer at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.10 over 0.30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.30</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.10 over 0.20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.20 over 0.10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.20</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.30 over 0.10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.30</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="p H equals 4.76 plus the log of the fraction 0.10 over 0.20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>4.76</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>log</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>0.20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
